alert.note: Alert for Surry (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 18 at 6:40PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: .A slow moving thunderstorm with very heavy rainfall rates was over southern Carroll County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central North Carolina and southwest Virginia, including the following counties, in north central North Carolina, Surry. In southwest Virginia, Carroll. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 639 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Cranberry Creek, Burks Fork, Ararat River, East Fork Little Reed Island Creek, Elk Spur Branch, Big Reed Island Creek, Crooked Creek, Brushy Fork, East Fork Crooked Creek, Garners Creek and Chestnut Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Airy... Hillsville... Fancy Gap... Cana... Woodlawn... Gladesboro... Pipers Gap... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
